concept.title: About
concept.shortdesc: The orange heart project mixes art and Dweb technology through a heart-centered perspective to explore addressing and resilience. The gallery component presents stencil-based spray art on birchwood.

section.p: A feature of decentralized technologies, such as IPFS, is replication. Content is stored in mulitiple places all over the web, closest to where it is used. Which makes it resilient. I've owned music which was banned. Even though those recordings were banned, there were copies of them all over the world. Decentralization works the same way. Except you get the exact same copy of content. That's one way of describing the decentralized web. It's a resilient system based on sharing information while still being able to prove that it's genuine.
That theme dovetails with stenciling. Stencils provide visual consistency that builds upon itself through repeated reuse.

Of course, stencils that are used over and over again degrade. Art degrades on any surface whether it is concrete or paper. Especially stencils, the more you reuse the stencil, the more paint it picks up and the image loses sharpness.

The stencil isn't just reused, its repurposed. The gallery show is a series of images created by a fairly old stencil, whereas the online component includes photographs of the world where the stencil acts as a frame.
In both cases, their edges are softening. Those are some of my thoughts, you can click below to see my bio.
